snippet: The White House said President Obama and Chancellor Angela Merkel discussed “ways to improve cooperation” after revelations of American spying activities jarred relations between the two countries.
abstract: Pres Obama and Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany discuss path forward during first telephone conversation since revelations of American spying activities jarred relations between their two countries; call, which included discussion of future intelligence cooperation, was described as friendly and cordial.
lead_paragraph: The White House said President Obama and Chancellor Angela Merkel discussed “ways to improve cooperation” after revelations of American spying activities jarred relations between the two countries.

headline.main: In Call, Obama and Merkel Discuss ‘Cooperation’ on Intelligence
headline.print_headline: In Call, Obama and Merkel Discuss ‘Cooperation’ on Intelligence
